body:
### Problem

During startup, nvim sources config files from `$XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` directories. However, this had two issues:

1. **`init.lua` was ignored** — Only `init.vim` was searched for, even though documentation states both should be searched.
2. **`$NVIM_APPNAME` was ignored** — Paths were hardcoded to `$XDG_CONFIG_DIRS/nvim/` instead of respecting `$NVIM_APPNAME`.

This meant configs like `$XDG_CONFIG_DIRS/myapp/init.lua` were never loaded, even when `$NVIM_APPNAME=myapp`.

Documentation references:
- [starting.txt L495-496](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/e51f5e17e18429b847be4e0d99698727dec47ca9/runtime/doc/starting.txt#L495-L496) — states both `init.vim` and `init.lua` should be searched
- [starting.txt L1440-1441](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/43339dee40aa7731cc644315c15080e30aa1a67c/runtime/doc/starting.txt#L1440-L1441) — states `$XDG_CONFIG_…/nvim` means `$XDG_CONFIG_…/$NVIM_APPNAME`

Fixes #37405

### Solution

Modify `do_system_initialization()` and `do_user_initialization()` to:
1. Search for `init.lua` before falling back to `init.vim` (consistent with `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME` handling)
2. Use `get_appname()` instead of hardcoded "nvim" for path construction
3. Show `E5422` error if both `init.lua` and `init.vim` exist in the same directory

comment_data.body:
IIUC (please confirm), it already worked for `init.vim`, and the missing part is that it didn't work for `init.lua` ? That one sentence is way more useful than all of the words spilled in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/37405 and related PRs :)

Then yes, this PR makes sense and we just need to clean it up a bit.

related tests live here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/f1dcde6cba3b2d69787f852a379ae2f7bc91c53d/test/functional/core/startup_spec.lua#L1134

can we use that block instead of duplicating the before_each/after_each things here.

the new test code is the main cost of this PR, if we can minimize it, and especially avoid duplication, then we are close to the finish line.
Yes, this already works for `init.vim`. The only problems are that it (1) doesn't pick up `init.lua` in that same directory, and that it (2) doesn't respect `NVIM_APPNAME`.

I see what you mean. I've done my best to get the amount of added tests under control. 

- Nested sysinit NVIM_APPNAME tests inside existing `describe('sysinit', ...)`
- Nested XDG_CONFIG_DIRS tests inside existing `describe('user config init', ...)`
- Removed duplicate E5422/init.vim fallback tests for XDG_CONFIG_DIRS with NVIM_APPNAME (same code path as without NVIM_APPNAME)

comment_regular_data.body: Would like to see actual demand (e.g. upvotes on https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/37405) before spending time on this. Have never heard anyone actually ask for this.

Very fair.

I suspect not many people are using `XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` at all to configure (neo)vim. Which would explain why nobody has run into the discrepancy between documentation and actual behavior.

I only got here through my adventures in using Nix to wrap NeoVim.

Adding to `XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` seemed like my most safe option to bundle a config from the read-only Nix store with nvim. Overwriting `XDG_CONFIG_HOME` seemed like a bad idea, but `XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` (bundled with `NVIM_APPNAME`) seemed perfect. It promised to do basically exactly the same as what a regular config in `XDG_CONFIG_HOME` would do.

Except that `init.lua` files didn't work... I got around that by using `-u` for a while but then ran into issues where `exrc` related stuff is skipped.

I'm currently using a custom `VIMINIT` to source my config. I think it's emulating what the initialization for `XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` would do.

```lua
vim.env.MYVIMRC = [[${configSource}/init.lua]]
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend([[${configSource}]])
vim.opt.runtimepath:append([[${configSource}/after]])
vim.cmd.source([[${configSource}/init.lua]])
```

> Adding to `XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` seemed like my most safe option to bundle a config from the read-only Nix store with nvim. Overwriting `XDG_CONFIG_HOME` seemed like a bad idea, but `XDG_CONFIG_DIRS` (bundled with `NVIM_APPNAME`) seemed perfect.

That is a good use-case to mention in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/37405

I've closed the previous PR (#37408) in favor of this one with both changes. It seems however that I can't edit the PR title. I wanted the title to summarize both changes:

```
fix(startup): source init.lua and respect $NVIM_APPNAME in $XDG_CONFIG_DIRS
```

This looks good, thanks! Merging now so it can bake before 0.12 release. Please followup on potential issues in the next weeks :)

I will add a note to `news.txt` also.
